TopicTitle: Drop Tanks (DROP) (see OP for current version - Download from CurseForge)

Articles.Content:
Drop Tanks (DROP)

Stockalike curved wrap around droptanks with an integrated decoupler

By zer0Kerbal, originally by @Enceos

adopted with express permission and brought to you by KerbSimpleCo

Description by Enceos

  • It's always nice to add some extra fuel without adding much to the size of the spacecraft
  • Has 4 sizes of different length
  • Very Fairing friendly due to its shape
  • Has a stock crossfeed switcher
  • Integrated decoupler
  • Aeroynamic nosecap to close the ends or make a boat
  • Stockalike texture will blend in with any craft
  • TweakScale support

See More

Spoiler
  • Drop Tank Wiki
  • GitHub Pages
  • Marketing Slicks

Help Wanted

Spoiler
  • Compatibility patches
  • Contracts for these glorious parts
  • Variant Textures
  • Contracts for these glorious parts
  • More models/textures like for the mk1 and other size profiles.
  • Marketing Images and Videos such as hero shots, animated gifs, short highlights
  • Translations: See the README in the Localization folder for instructions for adding or improving translations. There is also the quickstart guide. GitHub push is the best way to contribute. Additions and corrections welcome!
  • Have a request? Glad to have them, kindly submit through GitHub.

Localization

  •  English
  •  Dutch - thank you to @renejant (bedankt!)
  • your translation here

Installation Directions 1

Spoiler

Use CurseForge/OverWolf App (currently does not install dependencies)

I take no part, nor am I interested in maintaining the CKAN mod metadata for my mods. CKAN is a great mod for those that can't use zip tools. If you are having issues please let the CKAN people know and refer to the CKAN thread. My support of CKAN extends as far as me checking the checkbox in Spacedock when I upload. Beware, CKAN can really mess up though it tries very, very, very hard not to.

or 

Dependencies

  • Kerbal Hacks Ltd(KH/L)
  • Kerbal Space Program  2

Suggests

  • By Kerbal Hacks (KH/L)
    • Animated Station Screens (ASS)
    • Asphalt Tiles (AT)
    • Drop Tanks (DROP)
    • Hazard Tanks Textures (HZT)
    • KIS Props (KISP)
    • Large Stock Fairings (LSF)
    • More Asphalt Tiles (AT)
    • Portable Science Crate (PSC)
    • Simple Mission Flags (SMF)
    • Ven's Style Textures (VST)

Recommends

  • GPO (Goo Pumps & Oils') Speed Pump (GPO)
  • TweakScale (TWK)

Supports

  • On Demand Fuel Cells (ODFC)
  • Fuel Switchers
    • IFS core, FS core, CryoEngines, Stock Fuel Switch, Modular Fuel Tanks, Configurable Containers
  • Either 3
    • Module Manager /L
    • Module Manager

Tags

parts, resources, combat

is it updated already ? or do we need to wait with downloading???? a litte confused here

Edited August 13, 2022 by renejant
i would love to see a mk2 version that fits on the mk2 fuselage

CurseForge should have the listing/upload approved in the next 12-36 hours - it's their weekend (European based). Once it is approved it will propagate in minutes throughout their network and app. I was in a rush to push out the new listing.

CurseForge/Overwolf has been very good at rapidly approving listings and uploads for me as a whole; just occasionally I forget it's their weekend and they might be a tad bit slower in responding.

Quote

This is a new project. Until approved by a moderator, the project will not be visible to others, and its files will not synchronize across CurseForge.

I will ask the very effecient and much appreciated moderators to move this thread to Add-on Releases when CurseForge has approved the listing, release. 

7 hours ago, renejant said:

is it updated already ? or do we need to wait with downloading???? a litte confused here 

also; do you want me to do the Dutch translation?

@renejantIt is - just see above.

Yes please.

Here is the link to the <en-us.cfg> from which to translate. Do not have to do any of the individual part's tags (just the #DROP-tags string) because those strings are being removed and replaced with strings from Squad's internal dictionary. A GitHub PR into either '1.0.99.0-adoption'  or  '1.0.99.1-prerelease' branch would be appreciated.

I am now working on the next `Kerbal Hacks` release which might interest you as well. Several more to go as @Enceos has been wonderful in cooperating with my adoptions.

59 minutes ago, BGYT said:

i would love to see a mk2 version that fits on the mk2 fuselage

@BGYT

I would love to see that - am just not a modeler/graphic design artist - if a model/texture (even if it uses KSP's internal textures from mk1 parts) would be appreciated via PR push. Mk2, Mk3, Mk4, Mk5 as well.

Currently am planning on releasing 0.625m, 1.25m, 1.875m, 3.75m, and maybe even 5.0m version (without need for TweakScale) in upcoming releases.

Asset Updates

  • create Assets/ folder
  • convert from mesh to MODEL
  • rename
    • models to unique names
    • textures to unique names
  • update

  • relocate assets to Assets/

    • duplicate models
  • relocate part.cfg to Parts/

    • --> v2.0.0.0
    • --> v2.0.0.0
    • --> v2.0.0.0

Compatibility 1.0.99.0

  • Add
    • <InterstellarFuelSwitch.cfg> v1.0.1.0
      • missing drop-tank-bracelet-125 patch since, well, the mess below:
        • quantities, masses, and cost are totally messed up
        • don't have enough aspirin to take this one down
        • don't have a clue what Xe and EE (battery) should be
          • e.g. Cap tank is:
            • Structural
            • 65 LF
            • 45 LF + 55 OX
            • 40 MP
            • 45 LF + 55 OX + 30 MP
            • 1800 Xe
            • 1500 Xe + 20 MP
          • but should be?
            • Structural
            • 120 LF
            • 54 LF + 66 OX
            • 180 MP
            • 45 LF + 55 OX + 30 MP
            • 1800 Xe
            • 1500 Xe + 20 MP
    • <TweakScale.cfg> v1.0.0.0
      • all parts have a [bulkheadProfiles] = size1 but defaultScale of 2.5
        • didn't fix it because it's a bug in the original tweakscale.cfg

    • [Readme.md] v1.6.9.4
    • [_releaseNotes.md] v1.3.2.1
    • [.version]
      • remove [KSP_VERSION_MAX]
